text.p: Swiss bond futures ended higher ahead of expiry of March contracts on Monday. Prices firmed following release of U.S. producer prices, which were positive for U.S. Treasuries.
The March Confederate bond futures contract, which it a low of 119.90, closed at its session high of 120.50.

The benchmark June 2007 bond ended a fraction lower than on Thursday. The three-month Euroswiss contract traded on LIFFE was also higher on the day. Swiss money market traders said that one large Swiss bank may be holding onto liquidity ahead of futures' expiry, seen a factor keeping money rates high.
March Conf futures CONFH7 up 21 at 120.50.
March Comi medium-term bond COMIH7 up 20 at 112.20
Mar Euro Swiss francs FESH7 up four at 98.15.
